They say these pirates know how to swing an axe, so I've been looking for a fight to hone my own skills.
I may be here on business, but I do so enjoy visiting foreign ports. Limsa Lominsa has a character that is quite unlike that of my native Ul'dah. The lure of the exotic is indeed irresistible.
Whenever my business brings me to Limsa Lominsa, I treat my manservant to a hearty meal here at the Bismarck.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The Red Rooster Stead lies to the north of here, which is why we defend this highroad.

21 [0x0][0x20]: Most folk're still recoverin' from that thrice-damned Calamity, though, and are in sore need o' yer 'venturin' talents. Ye do yer best to put things to right, and I'll do me best to 'elp ye out when ye need it.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Speak with Momodi inside the Quicksand. That'd be the wisest thing for you to do.
Thinking of leaving already, are you? At least have a drink at the Quicksand before you go.
I don't believe I've seen you around here before. New adventurer, am I right? Then make your way to the Quicksand and register at the guild.
Try not to get lost, adventurer. Certain parts of this city are best left unexplored.
Ye want to come along on our trip to Crescent Cove, do ye? Well, ye ain't settin' foot on my boat unless ye pay forty gil.
If ye want a ride to the Silver Bazaar, ye'll need to pay forty gil up front. If ye don't got it, then I can't do anythin' for ye.
The door is sealed tight.
Have business with Owyne, do you? Very well, you may proceed.
The Heart of the Sworn lies beyond. Only those with pertinent business are permitted to enter.
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <if:madam/sir>.
We should be happy to serve you when you have sufficient funds, <if:madam/sir>.

<sigh> This is all I've got to show for a day's hunting. U'ralka will never let me hear the end of it.
How do you like this, adventurer? The great U'lamana is the only one among us who can bring down bigger game!
You stand before the abode of our tribe's most wise and noble chieftain. See to it that you act with propriety.
Our people live as hunters, but as we prey upon the creatures of the desert, so too do they prey upon us. Out here, the weak feed the strong─such is the law of nature.
Our tribe once dwelled here in peace, unconcerned with the affairs of the outside world. Alas, civilization encroaches ever nearer, bringing corruption and vice in its wake.
Might be as I'm doin' the teachin' now, but it only feels like yesterday that I was still droppin' my hora all over the place.
A pugilist is nothing without vigor, and few things are better for your vigor than hearty meals and lots of sleep. You could say I'm eating and sleeping my way to the top!

We gather here in great Thal's hall of worship to study the mysteries of thaumaturgy. I ask that you maintain a modicum of quietude. Hm? Oh no, not for us─we couldn't care less how loud you are. It's Priestess Mamane, you see. She's very strict about excessive noise.
Yes! Cast without constraint, my courageous colleagues! Draw on dweomers of dire and deadly destruction! Bwahahaha!
<shiver> The raw power of thaumaturgy has the potential to cause lethal devastation. Though I suppose that is what most practitioners of the art have in mind...
Hm? Judge me by my stature, do you? You'll not be so dismissive once I ensorcel you with somnolence and scrawl obscenities upon your face with demonblood ink! Hah!
The Calamity was man's doing! 'Twas our sins that brought the judgment and wrath of Azeyma! Repent, and thou shalt be showered in the Warden's light!
It's the lichyard that brings so many visitors to Camp Drybone. They come to grieve and to mourn their dead. Protect those you love, friend. It's a hard thing to see them put in the ground.

This camp lies on the road between the Black Shroud and Ul'dah. You'll find several places of note nearby. I suppose the two most well known are the Amalj'aa encampment, where the lizardmen nest, and the Church of Saint Adama Landama, where the thaumaturges tend the dead and worship Thal.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Now you know why there are so many Immortal Flames and corpses about. The former keep the Amalj'aa in check, and the latter are bound to be given back to the earth.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Have everything you need for a proper burial? If you find yourself wanting for aught, you'll find it at Camp Drybone!
Soon as my girl's fit for travel, we're gone. This is no place for the living...
The sun is as hot hands pressing down on you here. There's naught left of those who succumb to the heat but dry bones, hence the camp's name.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: I don't envy you adventurers in the slightest, what with all that gear and armor you must be carrying.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The Amalj'aa worship Ifrit─a vile being they proclaim to be the Lord of the Inferno.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: They say whosoever looks upon him must choose one of two fates─to follow him for life or be burned to ash. Not much of a choice, if you ask me.

19 [0x0][0x18]: We Immortal Flames are stationed here to keep an eye on the Amalj'aa in the region. Should you see any, do not draw too near, lest a simple grave at the lichyard await you.
This does not concern you. Please, let her grieve in peace.
Welcome to the Church of Saint Adama Landama. Our patron saint was a wealthy man in life, and so many merchants used to come calling to pray for his favor.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: But that all changed after the Calamity. Our small lichyard grew and grew as we took on the dead, and now we receive more mourners than merchants.

19 [0x0][0x18]: As an adventurer, you are familiar with guildleves, yes? If so, you have likely seen our Saint Adama Landama, for his wealth and munificence were such that some guildleves now bear his likeness.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: A strange state of affairs, though, that a church bearing the name of a rich saint should now be overrun with the poor who come to bury their dead.

19 [0x0][0x18]: It is my belief that this goobbue was present at the Battle of Carteneau five years ago. After its rider was struck down in battle, it sought shelter from the destruction raining down from the heavens, passing through the Twelveswood before arriving here in Thanalan.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: During this journey, the seeds of myriad plants came to cling to its body. Though the poor goobbue succumbed to its injuries in the end, these seeds would take root and eventually sprout from its carcass.
21 [0x0][0x20]: It's amazing to see such an amalgam of species from across Eorzea. To think that such beauty could arise from that terrible tragedy... The gods do indeed work in mysterious ways.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The Golden Bazaar is on the verge of unprecedented growth thanks to the mythril deposit! Mark my words, adventurer: there's billions in it! Billions!
There is no better time than now to be a miner. There are fortunes to be made, friend. Don't let this opportunity pass!
Pshhh... Shkohhh...\nAiryself lives in objects. When full of airyself, object changes to stonyshine, name of materia.
Master Mutamix is an inducted brother of the Illuminati, a goblin fraternity which has long been the marvel of the scholarly world. The knowledge they possess rivals even that of the Sharlayans.

Master Mutamix belongs to a fraternity of goblin scholars known as the Illuminati, but over time found himself at odds with their secretive ways. Believing that it is through dissemination that science evolves, he betrayed his own people, taking us under his wing to pass on the secrets of materia.
If you're buying or selling, speak up. Otherwise, I've business to attend to. Next!
My administrative duties require my undivided attention. Do not trouble me unless we have business to discuss.
It's a pain in the arse checkin' every shipment out of Vesper Bay, but somebody's gotta do it. Otherwise, crates might start fallin' off the backs of the wagons, if you catch my drift.
Wait! Aren't you...? Ah, never mind. Carry on.

Halatali was abandoned following the Calamity, along with the Coliseum beasts that were raised there. The creatures have since broken free of their cages and claimed the former training grounds as their lair.

Far be it from me to brag, but the blood of explorers courses through my veins. My grandpapa drafted the first comprehensive map of Eorzea, and I've made it my life's work to revise it to reflect the changes brought about by the Calamity.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: To this end, I've traveled all over Eorzea, and there's nary a place in the realm I've not seen with mine own eyes. Mayhap I could direct you to some of the more interesting locales I've explored─that is, if you're not afraid of a little danger.

19 [0x0][0x18]: None may enter the Fragrant Chamber without permission. I must ask that you step away from the doors, <if:madam/sir>.
Above all else, we Gridanians value harmony. By our example, we hope to guide the realm to an age of true peace.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: If man and elemental can work as one, so too can the peoples of Eorzea join hands in common cause. I pray you will continue to aid us in achieving this ideal.

19 [0x0][0x18]: My name is Lewin, and I lead the men and women of the Gods' Quiver. It is our duty to preserve the peace in the Twelveswood.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The Ixal and the Garleans see to it that we have nary a moment's rest. As such, we always welcome the assistance of dependable adventurers such as yourself.

19 [0x0][0x18]: All vessels that make use of Limsa Lominsa's ports must submit to a cargo inspection and pay the duties incurred. Please direct all inquiries and complaints to the front desk of Mealvaan's Gate.
Please, not another word! If I am ever to become an official assessor, this training exercise must be the focus of my full and undivided attention!
Cap'n Rhoswen's led the Sanguine Sirens to the top o' the food chain 'ere in Limsa. Ye want to join the meanest crew on the sea, then ye'd best bloody yer cutlass an' thicken yer 'ide.
If it is rumors or like-minded fellows you seek, then you have made the right choice in coming to this tavern. It is as a lodestone for all manner of travelers and explorers.
Our guild 'as a fine collection o' live fish in the pool there. It's always squirmin' with the latest catch, ye see.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: An' when the sea's been unkind with 'er bounty, I just drop a line in all sneaky-like an'─ Ahem, fine weather we're 'avin', ain't it?

19 [0x0][0x18]: Are you hoping to join our crew? You'll have to walk to the back of the line and wait your turn with these others. Perhaps the captain'll like your face; perhaps he'll pitch you over the wall.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: There are many and more willing to risk his fickle favor for a chance to serve on Llymlaen's most beloved ship.

19 [0x0][0x18]: My son has flown the nest, and I know naught of what has become of him. Each day I buy more fish than I need, that I might have a meal to feed him should he wander back through our door.
Some captains claim to 'ave the biggest, toughest pirate crews in Limsa, but no bastard makes that boast afore the gathered axes o' the Bloody Executioners.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: We been to the very edges o' the eastern seas, an' plucked treasures from the 'olds of imperial ships. These other scrags ain't naught but piss an' wind.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The Admiral's ban on piracy has proven effective, by and large. The only problem is, the ones that refuse to give up the life are the absolute bloody worst of the lot.

It is said that the odd pillars on the Salt Strand were formed the night Bahamut's flames rained from the heavens. I am currently studying the formations to see what influence, if any, they exert on the surrounding area.
Chocobos are such sensitive creatures. Without a steady stream of care and affection, they soon fall into the blackest depression.
Have you heard the tale behind the name of this quaint little place? It all started with the birth of a rooster, feathers as red as wine. Would that the story ended there...
20 [0x0][0x1c]: See, the farmers laid wagers on this bird being stronger than the others, but the contest grew ugly. Blades were drawn, and both roosters and onlookers were splattered with scarlet shades of blood. Not so quaint now, eh?

19 [0x0][0x18]: Most seafarers a bloke meets are rougher'n a barnacled hull, but these Lominsan scrags are somethin' else. S'pose I should expect naught less from a city what was founded by pirates.

Since I've been stationed here, I've learned more about ale than I thought possible. The folk here taught me that sailors stock barrels of the weaker stuff for long voyages, as even the freshest water will turn foul after a time.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: And the stronger stuff? Well, that gets bought up by the merchants visiting Aleport. Lower taxes on our local brews, you see.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Why don't ye join me for a pint or two, <if:lass/lad>? The grog's as cheap as water in this place! Even so, I reckon I've guzzled through half the sparklies I hoarded from me mercenary days, heh heh.
Adventurer wants going to shop of Jijiroon? Adventurer give forty gil!
Adventurer has no gil? Then adventurer has no go!

I was most pleased to discover the attitude of acceptance towards beastman traders here in Limsa Lominsa. My fellow Ul'dahn merchants openly despise such savage peddlers, you see, but I believe there are opportunities being missed.

21 [0x0][0x20]: The bulging packs of the goblins? They often contain naught of value, but it is worth sifting through the junk for that one rare treasure. And the Qiqirn? Look no further should you wish to trade for ore or gemstones.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Welcome to Candlekeep Quay. Head within and speak with the skipper if you require passage to Aleport.

21 [0x0][0x20]: The facilities here had to be expanded to accommodate the flood of artisans and supplies needed for the restoration efforts.

20 [0x0][0x1c]: I have but recently been appointed chief assistant to vice-chairman Bango Zango. Ah, brokering deals and negotiating trade contracts...it is my calling in life.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Do you seek admittance to the Lotus Stand? If so, I will show you in.
The Lotus Stand lies beyond this grove, but I cannot admit you. The Elder Seedseer is not receiving visitors at present.
Through this first mission, you will come to understand the nature of our struggle with the primals.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The realm may appear well on its way to recovery, but reality paints a far bleaker picture.

19 [0x0][0x18]: This place is called the Waking Sands, and it's our headquarters.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: It used to be somewhere else, you know, but then a bunch of things happened, and we ended up here instead!

While there are others who possess the Echo, none are near as strong as you with the power. Hence our extremely high expectations of you!
While there are others who possess the Echo, none are near as strong as you with the power. Hence our extremely high expectations of you!
Five years ago, the three Grand Companies joined as one and fought the Garlean Empire at the Carteneau Flats.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: And now, for the first time, the people will gather to remember those who fell in the battle.
21 [0x0][0x20]: That being said, no one has any clear memory of what transpired that fateful day─not even the leaders of each nation.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Summoning a primal is no small feat. It requires a tremendous concentration of aether, which is why the beast tribes go to such lengths to obtain crystals.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Once they manifest in physical form, their unquenchable thirst for aether only grows stronger. They would drink the land dry with nary a thought to the consequences.
21 [0x0][0x20]: Considering their fearsome strength, it could be well within their ability to do so. It is for this reason we must do our utmost to oppose them.

Our organization, the Scions of the Seventh Dawn, was formed through the union of two separate entities. The first was comprised of Sharlayan natives such as myself, and was called the Circle of Knowing.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The second, made up of individuals that share your rare gift, was known as the Path of the Twelve.
21 [0x0][0x20]: The terrible events that ushered in the Seventh Umbral Era taught us that only together may we stand against the evil that seeks to consume us.

19 [0x0][0x18]: I have heard word of your deeds. I am sparing in my praise, so know that you have truly impressed me.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Be that as it may, it is fortunate that Thancred arrived when he did. Had he been but a moment later, I shudder to think what may have transpired.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Seven waning moons see seven suns rise,\nDivine order roils, fallen corpses writhe.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Thus the Divine Chronicles seek to warn us once more. The meaning of these words now shines clear: they evoke the dire circumstance of this imperiled age.
21 [0x0][0x20]: The realm doth shudder and twist, and the dawn lieth cowering 'neath the stifling blanket of night. And we abide. We await the coming of the unborn era's seed─the light which shall pierce the glowering darkness.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The destruction that visited this land cannot be attributed to the forces of the Empire alone.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Wyrm of midnight, of breath infernal... For some, a legend made flesh; for others, an insidious symbol of memory lost.
21 [0x0][0x20]: We grasp but a piece of this puzzle. Much and more must we question and contemplate ere the fallen moon revealeth its myriad secrets.

19 [0x0][0x18]: In the years before the Calamity, my organization, the Path of the Twelve, took under its wings those possessed of unique powers, that they might employ their talents for the good of the realm.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Although we have since made common cause with the Circle of Knowing and taken on the name of the Scions, our objective remains the same─safeguarding the future of Eorzea.
21 [0x0][0x20]: Come what may, it is my hope that this spirit shall ever live on within brave souls such as you.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Let me see if I have this right─you're an adventurer...who's a Scion...and a >? Golly, how do you keep track of everything?
20 [0x0][0x1c]: It must be fun pairing up with lots of different people, though! Me? I'm always with Papalymo.\n...Come to think of it, why am I always with Papalymo?

19 [0x0][0x18]: Following the Calamity, each nation's armed forces underwent large-scale restructuring centered upon its Grand Company.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: In Gridania, the Order of the Twin Adder absorbed both the Wood Wailers and the Gods' Quiver, while the Lominsans enacted the complete merger of the Maelstrom and the Knights of the Barracuda.
21 [0x0][0x20]: Ul'dah is the odd nation out, having made no notable changes to its armed forces. As before, and in the spirit of the sultanate, each entity retains a certain degree of independence.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The incident with the traitor still weighs heavily on everyone's minds─the Flame General's most of all.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: And although he cannot be expected to know what evil lurks in the hearts of every man under his command, the revelation is nevertheless a devastating blow to his authority.
21 [0x0][0x20]: Even so, it warrants saying that you should not let this tragedy color your opinion of the man. In all my years working with the Flame General, I've never had reason to doubt his capacity to lead.

19 [0x0][0x18]: We will continue to focus our efforts on investigating the primals. The Amalj'aa are not the only tribe that has succeeded in summoning its deity.
Fate shall be thy guide. When our purposes become one, once again shall our paths lead us here...
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Our city of learning is now naught but shadows. Ere the light of dawn breaketh, shall we follow whither the sand blows.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Greetings, <forename>. If you have business with Admiral Bloefhiswyn, the Admiral's Lift stands ready to bear you aloft.
The door is sealed tight.
Come to check on me, have you? Well, you may rest assured I have found new purpose at this humble post, and I have no intention of abandoning it again.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: All that I have learned from my commander, I shall employ in service to the Wood Wailers and Gridania at large. 'Tis the least I can do to repay him for all he has done for me.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Ever a sight for sore eyes, my friend. My thanks again for your patience with Landenel.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Your presence was instrumental in helping him to let go of the past, I believe, and now he can focus on forging his own future. I look forward to seeing what he makes of himself in the years to come.

19 [0x0][0x18]: When the sultan Sasagan Ul Sisigan, first of his line, founded the nation of Ul'dah, he decreed that the Royal House of Ul would ever be attended by a sworn brotherhood of elite warriors.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Under Captain Jenlyns's leadership, we carry on that sacred tradition. The captain himself labors tirelessly to keep the sultana safe from those who plot against her.
21 [0x0][0x20]: Alas, there are many who would welcome her fall...

19 [0x0][0x18]: Limsa Lominsa is not unique in her suffering; all the nations of Eorzea struggle with a multitude of hardships.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The difficulties of this age will not be surmounted without the aid of you and your fellow adventurers, thus I pray that your eagerness and compassion never wane.

19 [0x0][0x18]: My loyalty goes beyond obedience. If your deeds would serve Master Gegeruju's interests, then my deeds shall serve yours.
Just because I, Bango Zango, preside as second chair over the Brugaire Consortium, does not mean I have the time to consort with all and sundry.
Sure, farm life sounds plenty splendid and all, but for some reason, I'm not quite ready to give up this drudgery.
I realize I'm a tiny fish amid a sea of sharks, but I think there are enough shrewd traders in this cutthroat market for an honest peddler to carve out a decent niche.
My Ice Princess is the most graceful vessel ever to glide across the open seas. The waves can spin her round and round, but she'll never fall down.
The Thaumaturges' Guild is run by five siblings. The eldest is Cocobuki, who is recognized as guildmaster. After him are Cocobygo, Cocobani, Cocobezi, and Cocoboha.

My li'l sis was the only family I had left...till the flux up and took her away, too. 'Tweren't easy, but I brung her all the way here. Now all's left is to put her to rest proper, like she deserves.

I was born and raised to the west of here. You won't find the village on recent maps, though. The Sahagin removed any need to mark it.

Ain't but one thing ye need to succeed in life, an' that's gumption. Had not a gil to me name when I started searchin' for shells to sell, but look at me now─got me own proper business, an' I ain't had to gather shells meself in years!

Hm? Are you perchance looking to purchase fresh fish? Well, I...uh...I'm afraid I just sold the last of my stock! Very sorry, friend, but due to my reputation as a first-rate fisherwoman, my wares are quite popular!

With the coming of the everlasting snows, each year's harvest grows ever poorer. It falls to the Confraternity of Fisherfolk to ensure that the people of Coerthas do not want for sufficient sustenance.

I fully acknowledge that we can learn much about ancient Allag by studying its people's dietary habits. Nevertheless, I would have greatly preferred that anyone else be given charge of this research...

Never gone fishing in the desert? There's no difference between sand and sea once your quarry is on the hook.
The true test of a knight comes against the foes he cannot slay. The cold is indeed harsh, but the snows shall only serve to harden my resolve.

When I come here and look out over the Twelveswood, I can feel the elementals watching over me, protecting me. I close my eyes, open my ears to the sounds of the forest, and let all my troubles disappear.
Why, I've served RayaO since she was a little girl no bigger than me, kupo! She has matured much since the Calamity. Her brother ARuhn, on the other hand...
When she was a child, RayaO had quite a temper. She's a sweet little girl now, but a moogle does not easily forget. Even now, the sound of her voice makes my fur stand on end, kupo!
I fear entry to Milvaneth Sacrarium is forbidden for the nonce. Repairs are underway to remedy the rot and dilapidation that have spread within.
The people of this land would kill me for no more than my Amalj'aa skin. And so I must remain here, in hiding.

Josselin─whose name this spire bears─was a legendary captain from the Wood Wailers' early days. Whenever my bow falters, I need only remind myself that my forebears fight in spirit by my side.
Walking ones may think this one's home is small, but this one has biggest home of all! The forest itself is this one's home! What does walking one think of that?
I can't talk to those sylphs. Yes, they scare me a little. Look, they aren't like you and me, you'd be talkin' to them and they'll just start...messin' with you.
It is a sight to gladden the heart, isn't it? A garden to exalt the Twelve is a daunting task indeed, and ever do I strive. But sometimes─sometimes, I simply enjoy the beauty we have wrought.

I feel truly privileged to be involved in the restoration of the Sanctum. Returning each masterpiece to its original glory is like glimpsing into the mind of the artisan from whose hands it was wrought.

Of late, more and more people are being joined here in the Ceremony of Eternal Bonding. Seeing newly bound couples come out of the chapel with happiness writ upon their faces never fails to set my heart aflutter!
20 [0x0][0x1c]: When will my turn come, I wonder...

Happenings at Takers' Rot and Redbelly Hive, the latest rumors concerning Urth's Fount... Why, if I have to write another report, my arm is going to fall clear off!
Antelope and dormice abound in these parts, but we must be careful not to hunt more than befits our need. What the forest gives, it can just as easily take away.
My dad's off hunting, and I'm bored, bored, boooooored! Isn't there anything fun to do around here?
This keep was built by the Amdapori, a people whose civilization flourished during the Fifth Astral Era. I wonder how they would feel if they learned that the place has become a haven for cultists.

Fallgourd Float's famed for its fragrant teas and warm hospitality. With such comforts at their disposal, wayfarers oft find that they're in no great hurry to resume their journey and face the perils of the road.
They call this place Alder Springs. Do you see the trees around you? We must never forget that this is their home, and that we reside here only by their sanction.

Cork? Why, one uses it as a stopper, very useful for meeker sorts of potions.\n...Oh, the Bobbing Cork! Yes, it rafts upon Fallgourd Float. Why? Well, lakes need no clearing but forests do, or so they tell me.
Gold in the hills, gold in me purse～♪\nThe eatings out here ain't much, but me wife's cooking's that much the worse～♪
Hammering away night and day has my arms achy and my tummy rumbly! Sometimes the weight of my pick is simply too much to bear. Then I turn my thoughts to my sick mum at home...
There's gold in these here hills─I can feel it in me bones. It called me here from Ul'dah, and you can bet I ain't goin' back home till I've mined meself a fortune.
The Elder Seedseer has placed great store in you adventurers. I pray that you will reward her faith by reaching out to aid the people of Gridania.
When I look at her, I feel as though I've come home. I can think of no other way to express it.
Beyond this gate lies Sorrel Haven. A “haven” indeed...for some of the most fearsome beasts you're ever like to lay eyes on. Passage will be granted only to those who can see to their own safety.
Were I to substitute the aether value in accordance with the professor's law of conversion, that would produce a theoretical limit of ten score five and fifty...or should there be no limit?

An aesthete is by nature cruel, because crude things offend our nature and there will be so much crudeness. And oh, won't someone throw a pearl in my wine?
Gegeroon work for Memeroon. Always many, many works. Gegeroon make many, many shinies!
I haven't had many visitors out here of late. Did you come to danger near Poor Maid's Mill? An unfortunate name for an unfortunate place, that.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: It was once a lively hub for loggers, till they were all killed off by wild beasts. Only their impoverished widows were left behind. Not quite sure why they came to be called maids, though...

19 [0x0][0x18]: I fear that convalescence has blunted my mind even as it knits together my wounded body. I know myself to be fortunate, for I have met others here who see kobolds around every corner, but I must not forget that my war goes on.
Welcome to the Warmwine Sanitorium. Here, we treat the wounded from the front with healing waters from the very womb of the earth, and heated wine redolent with spices.

Remember Carteneau, I say! I was there under the Maelstrom standard and for every drop of my blood, the Garleans paid double! The Twelve willing, I'll fight again, and if I fall? Why, I'll see my comrades from the Flats again!
That...that boom of the magitek armor. Can't stop hearing it...see how my hand shakes so? Used to be that I'd pinch myself on my face, for sure and certain. Least I'm clear of that.

That smarts! The Twelve spit in my eye if I lie, that smarts like Ifrit himself skewered me with a stick of how-do-ye-do! I'd like to git me hands on that Garlean what mistook me for his pincushion...
Tra-la-la, I do believe this is just right! Not too hot, not too cold.
I came here by way of the Wanderer's Palace. Oh, how you would love it there, a daring adventurer like you! There are automata contrived into the very walls...dozens of secret rooms there must be.
Don't you go coddlin' any ideas of gold and glory─nuthin' hale will rise from that bed. The Wanderer's Palace is more a tomb than a trove.
Who in the seven hells are ye? Ye stand on the front lines of outer La Noscea. If yer not ready to fight for yer bloody life, ye'd best march right back to wherever ye came from.
I jus' stands here and looks for the supply balloon. 'Tain't the food what's short but the fresh meat. Meat's important to a body on account of we being made of it or sumfin'.

Arrr, it's been years since I gave up piratin' to serve an honest life in the Maelstrom. But between you an' me, there are still days when I can hear the sea callin' me home. An' I reckon I'm not the only one, aye.
Adventurer! When you're tired of culling birds and moles, come hunt the sandworm with us!
We must think beyond our ken! If you have ideas, bring them to me, the next nunh of Forgotten Springs─no matter how peculiar they seem.

Oh, but it does make sense, it really does! If you come by oxcart, it feels like half a malm, and like two malms if you come on foot. So to a minotaur it would be exactly a malm! \nActually, now that I've said it...hm.
Unfriendly sort of folk, the U. Asked leave to use one of their empty bunks once and they near threw me out of town.

Southern Thanalan is rife with Amalj'aa. After a goodly number of parleys with the nunh of the U, we were able to establish an Immortal Flames outpost here. Now, we work together against the lizardmen.
The Allagans were a powerful people all right─but I'd venture to guess it was all this heat that did them in. One more year here and I'll be needin' a sarcophagus.
The sand gets in your head, I tell you. Some days I'm not even sure if I'm digging or burying. The Sagolii Desert's like a yellow-eyed harlot─knocks you flat and leaves you high and dry.
We U are a very cleanly people. Return home sticky with sweat, sand, and blood of the prey? These springs will see it all washed away.
You'd be wise to hold fast your weapon in these parts. Castrum Meridianum bears down on us from the north, the Garleans poised to strike at a moment's notice.
Each step north brings us closer to the Garlean threat, and each day brings us closer to war.
A dear friend of mine died by Garlean hands, and I joined the Immortal Flames to avenge him. But now that I'm here... <gulp>
I like to think that the fire in my heart burns as strongly as anyone else's. But when I behold the might of the Garleans, I can't help but be struck dumb.
It's trying, not knowing when death will finally come for you. My mind often wanders to the family I left behind.
Every day carries its share of lumps, bumps, strains, sprains, bruises, and broken bones.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: I've treated blacksmiths, goldsmiths, alchemists, botanists, armorers, leatherworkers, miners, carpenters, you name it─never lost a patient yet.

19 [0x0][0x18]: I keep watch over yonder field for Garlean activity. Though half the time I can see nary ten yalms ahead for the accursed fog.
Sentry duty's mind-numbin' work at the best o' times. It takes the perseverance of a bleedin' saint to keep yer wits about ye for when ye actually need 'em.
The final phase of Operation Archon is at hand! The time is come for the Immortal Flames to burn hotter and brighter than ever before!
Nothing quenches the thirst and settles the mind quite like a glass of apple wine at the end of a hard day's work. 'Tis pure bliss!
Have y'ever seen apples so lovely? As red as a fine lass's rosy cheeks, and thrice as sweet!
We've got more than our fair share of problems here, but all's well that ends with a hearty meal at the end of the day!
Some of ours have had to remain outside the hamlet. They're hardened soldiers, all, and no strangers to discomfort, but it's a trying experience, being in a place that loves you not.

By Nophica's grace, the Twelveswood was not subjected to the transformative forces which forever altered Coerthas. At least, that was the case five years ago. Some say the snows creep ever southward...
Damn and blast, that hurts! The Ixal peck hard, curse their godless, feathered hearts...
Gods, heal already, I have places to be! I'll bet Miah Molkot didn't become what she is playing nursemaid to some clodpole.
A host of Ixal? I ssspit on numbers! The White Rams hunt the Ixal─oh yes, we live to spring unexpectedly on little birds and snap their wee necks!
Who are the Sons of Saint Coinach? We are but the finest minds in Eorzea, drawn together to decipher the ancient mysteries of the Allagan civilization.
The work goes well─or well enough, considering the challenges we face. The scourge of giants and forces inimical to scholarship rob me of my sleep...
Consider the lesser moon, Dalamud, and the ancient Allagan ruins. Add the speculative connection, divide by the Crystal Tower...
When there's this much snow in Coerthas, the trade route seals up tighter than a goobbue's arse. But you know the thing about cold─it sells a lot of firewood and firewater!
Let the rabble blither what they will over their rude cups. Fourth he may be of his father's loins, but Ser Francel is first in piety and discernment. Skyfire Locks can be in no better hands.
Know you the reason Skyfire Locks is thus devised─a handful of diamonds tossed upon a hillside, rather than a carcanet of brilliants decorously arranged?
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The Locks are shelter for our people against dragons. Scattered is safer─one cannot steal a necklace if there is none to steal.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Curse Sylvaintel, that long-faced martinet! There never was a night as cold as this, yet he begrudges us more wood for the fire. I would gladly─especially if 'twere Sylvaintel─kill for a mug of warmwine.
See how the Observatorium pierces the very heavens! What a view those astrologians must have, high above the murk that you and I toil in...
What do you think? Larger and warmer than you expected, I'll warrant. This fort is also a place of shelter for the commonfolk. 'Tis better to rebuild a dragon-seared home than burn with it.
How fares the weather? A storm in these parts means no runners can be sent to the next fort, nor can any signals be seen. Once the whiteness falls, each Lock is as an island and must fend for itself.

A knight of Ishgard lives to serve, and lives to fall in battle. Every last one of us is fated for this holy duty long before we are born─and when the last dragon perishes, we shall meet again in the hall of our fathers.
The arms of House Fortemps is a unicorn, erased and wreathed in thorns. The unicorn is unique to Coerthas but...they are hardly to be found in these parts. A shame.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Do you like the shield upon my back? The painter did excellent work, I feel. I do like the unicorn's horn.

19 [0x0][0x18]: I never tire of watching the flames. And I've no complaints about the warmth!
How many years now since I left the Gods' Quiver for a life of a sellsword? Long enough to end up this far north, brrr. Wonder how Instructor Molkot's faring with all the green recruits...
Hm, an adventurer come from <switch:>, huh? Well, I don't want your kind here. <switch:> Now off with you!
The dance with the dragons, the canker of unbelievers... We stand on the edge of the precipice, and beyond it, endless night bereft of the grace of Halone...
The light of the Holy See shines on Coerthas, and illumes it from the highest peaks to the blackest tunnels. What need we fear from dragons and unbelievers?

See you, what has become of the stately Gates of Judgement... I was but a babe in arms when first I passed under its fragrant shadow. A thousand curses upon the dragons─they would mar all that I hold dear.
I've a plan to retake the Stone Vigil, but a mountain of problems to solve before I can even go to my commander. A man dreams of glory, but an army must think of success...
Muahahaha! Cower, you vermin, crawl on your soft bellies! Receive the kiss of the dragon, renounce the wet pulp of your flesh!
Can't...keep...eyes...open... Card...game...ran...late... I lost anyway, what rotten luck! And...zzz...
It is all manner of cold outside: wet, dry, stinging, lancing. Unless I can get some hot food into those knights, it will take the heart from them.

I am a knight of Ishgard, the sworn lance of the Holy See, the scourge of unbelievers, and the foe implacable of dragonkind. It has ever been my dream to be one of the glorious dead, and receive my just reward from Halone in the heavenly garden.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Yet life is sweet, and my friends are dear to me─none more so than my steed and her chocobokeep Maucolyn. The clerics say birds do not go to heaven, and to want otherwise is heresy─which makes an unbeliever of me if they but knew.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Born into such a house as mine, where else to aim but the pinnacle? My destiny is to serve as the Temple Knight, for the greater glory of Ishgard!
I am a part of the expedition to Snowcloak, and there I am bound in short order. My task was to replenish the supplies─in the camp, food has grown almost as scarce as warmth.
You saw Snowcloak, I take it. There once was a settlement further west, a hamlet by the name of Falcon's Nest─cut off by the ice cliff now, of course.
I've my own reasons for volunteering for this expedition. This icy bulk holds my heart─and not a day or night in the last five years have I not felt the weight of winter upon my breast.

In the years after the Calamity, this place was a barren wasteland, with nary a shrub to be found. It was Guildmaster Fufucha─her skill, her knowledge, and her love for the trees most of all─who gave this forest new life.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Were it not for her, I would not be here today. Nay...like as not, I would never have chosen the botanist's path. The profound joy and satisfaction that my life's work has brought me─I owe it all to her.

The wretched squalor of this place concerns the Ul'dahns not... And of those who flocked to help at first, only Father Iliud has remained steadfast.
So many tragedies have befallen us in recent years. The Calamity, the primals...  Alas, it is only within our power to shepherd the souls of the fallen, and pray that they find peace in Thal's realm.
Water to fetch, weeds to pull... A shabby lichyard is a slight to the living and the dead alike.
Rest in peace, dear uncle. Technically, a cousin thrice removed, but who's counting? We're too busy dividing up that estate of yours.
Oh, there's work enough from the church but nothing you'd call cheery.
Though I am not qualified to assist with the rites, I offer what assistance I can to the priests. Sometimes I wonder if I'm just getting in the way, though...
Rhalgr take this desert heat! Ahhh, I'd give anythin' to be back in the crisp mountains of Ala Mhigo.\n...Well, perhaps not my freedom.

Grrr! My belly churns like a raging river at the mere sight of Amalj'aa! Is it not the same for you!?

Welcome to the Sunken Temple of Qarn─or what remains of it, at least. Used by ancient Belah'dians as a place to worship the sun goddess, Azeyma, much about the temple's history remains shrouded in mystery.
We're soldiers o' the Resistance, godsdammit! Every wakin' moment oughta be spent tryin' to liberate our people! But everywhere I look, I see nothin' but layabouts!
I went to Ul'dah hoping to find honest work, but there wasn't a single job to be had. At least nothing that didn't require me to give up my dignity.
The Ala Mhigans who ended up here are the ones who couldn't─or wouldn't─adapt to a new lifestyle. In a sense, we're Ala Mhigans through and through.
'Course I hate the Garleans─they took our homeland an' all that. But right now what I want most is to not feel hungry all the bleedin' time.
A ways northeast of here you'll find the Sepulchre─a frightfully named place, no? Fitting, though, seeing as how it's best known as home to the villainous Corpse Brigade.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: To think that the erstwhile Kingsguard of Ala Mhigo could end up a band of murderers and thieves. Mind you, they had a less-than-pristine reputation in the old days as well.

19 [0x0][0x18]: The folk you meet here may seem boorishly provincial, but do try to show them some mercy. Had you been driven from your home and forced to wallow in disease and poverty, I doubt you'd fare much better.

As much as I enjoy the creative aspect of goldsmithing─drawing out the hidden potential of Eorzea's natural bounty and so forth─I understand that it is first and foremost a means to an end. What use is a masterpiece if no one will purchase it?
Things are fairly calm at the present, but as soon as there is a sortie, we shall have our hands full again. We could use another chirurgeon, certainly.
You may partake of the warmth of our hearth, but never forget that within these walls the word of House Durendaire is law.
Common is the nation which has warred with its neighbors. But our neighbors are dragons─relentless and merciless creatures.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Through generations of conflict and sacrifice, we have honed our warcraft with fire and blood. All to survive, all to triumph. Anything less, and we would not be here today.

19 [0x0][0x18]: There's raw, and there's raw. I may still be green, but I can stand sentry now without limping afterwards. That counts for something.

You're not going to make me leave, are you? I know I've no right to be here, but it's cold outside, a-and there were wolves chasing me...
An empty larder, a full barracks, and an inadequate kitchen. Is there any cook with a worse lot in life?
Gods, I'm so hungry! I must eat something soon, lest the sentries mistake the growling of my stomach for that of a ravenous scalekin!
How can I be expected to fight on an empty stomach? I'm not derelict in duty─I'm incapable of duty!
Strategy, sticky flummery! A spear held...thusly! Dragons skewered...thusly! What need for a plan beyond this, I ask?
Resources are extremely limited at the front lines, so some patients must make do with food and bed rest. We cannot be expected to dole out medicine to each and every one.
The cells here are home to all manner of cultists and heretics. You'd do well not to provoke them.
This bell is the very same one in the sigil of House Durendaire. It is a symbol more so than an instrument for raising alarum.

A hammer's a dangerous thing in a hand gone numb. The Smith of Winter has my fingers in her vice─I've a need of an occasional thaw by the fire, or I'm liable to send that hammer flying into a knightly noggin.
There is a hunter that stalks the sick and the wounded, and its name is winter. This far north, warm beds and nourishing food are not to be found in any great quantity...

In bygone times, the Stone Vigil was a staunch outpost against the dragons─nowadays, it's bloody crawling with the beasts. That's why this gate is sealed shut unless an order comes down saying otherwise.
You stand before Dzemael Darkhold─carved out of an extensive cavern system as a safe haven from dragon raids. I would invite you to take a tour, but I'm afraid that it's off-limits at the moment.
Dzemael Darkhold is a subterranean fortress excavated by the great Ishgardian house of the same name. None but authorized personnel may enter.
The air within the Aurum Vale is thick with noxious gases, fatal even in small doses. If you must enter, do so fully prepared.
You have done well to brave the frozen wilderness, adventurer. Stay awhile and be warm.
You are not leaving snow and ice in your wake, I hope? The melted stuff is right hazardous, mark you. Not a moon ago, I near broke my neck when I slipped and took a tumble.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: I have survived countless campaigns against the dragons; I would sooner not be remembered as the knight who was undone by a puddle. The laughter would surely follow me all the way to the great beyond.

19 [0x0][0x18]: All adventurers worth their salt gather in Revenant's Toll. If you've a mind to rise above the sea of mediocrity, you've come to the right place.

Time was I took on every odd job offered me, runnin' messages an' cullin' pesky fauna like a good little adventurer. But I'm well past that now. These days there's only one thing on my mind, and it's what's brought me here.
It seems the fate of Monument Tower to watch the watcher. 'Twas built to guard the Fury's Gaze, and the stone beyond price hidden in its depth...
20 [0x0][0x1c]: And now it keeps vigil against the Garlean outpost, for the jewel that is Ishgard must never fall into the Empire's unclean hands.

Don't cozen yourself, the gil's good around here because the nasties are that nasty. But what you really need to reckon against are the Garleans.
In every and all things, I like my planning perfect and my execution precisely as predetermined. A stickler for detail─that is simply the way I am.
Prrray do not cause a disturbance whilst staying in Forgotten Springs. We have enough pressing concerns as it is.
Bloody 'ells me throat's parched! Can't wait till me shift's over so I can drown meself in ale! Aye, that an' a buxom bar wench to dandle on me lap!
This is where we detain pirates and smugglers and other such rogues till we decide as what to do with 'em. See to it you do naught as earns you a place here.

You know how ale's brewed, adventurer? You take malted barley, ferment it with yeast, then add herbs and spices to give it character. The stuff is a deal cheaper than wine, and for that it's loved by the smallfolk.

Ye need to keep stables warm, especially down on the ground. Chocobos are jus' like us, in that they ain't built for the cold. They can take it, to be sure, but that don't mean they don't suffer somethin' terrible.

Have you come in search of House Durendaire's protection? A wise decision if so. House Haillenarte may claim Skyfire Locks to be the most secure stronghold in this region, but even a fool can see how mistaken that is.
The manor I once served in was no less magnificent than those found in the Gentry's Ward yonder. And magnificent it should be, for it was formerly home to generations of Seedseers.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: However, the Elder Seedseer before the last declared that he needed not such extravagance, and the abode came into the ownership of the Dartancours family.

19 [0x0][0x18]: We intend to establish a base of operations here, but the environs remain most inhospitable. Without Rolfe's aid, we'd be lost.
My friends and I call ourselves gold diggers. Why? Because we dream of striking it rich at a stroke! Hahaha!\n...All right, it's not that funny. I'll shut up now. Ahem.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Honored ally. Thanks to you and your friend, I have returned home to the Ring of Ash─and was not forced to smash the bones of any small men along the way.
Our foe is defeated, and our hatchlings returned to the safety of the Ring of Ash. But the great battle waged by our Brotherhood rages on. Your strength is always welcome here, honored ally.
Squawk! Ixali oaknot, featherless neuker carries? Make trade with you, this one will!
Currency of Ixal, oaknot is. Oaknot, you find? Trade, we will make─even with featherless neuker. Squawk!
The wonder to the east is the Gate of the Sultana, built after the Calamity. Such is the power of Ul'dah! And beyond lie the Steps of Nald.
Careful─have you not heard the expression, “an aurochs in Scorpion Crossing”? This is the hub of trade in these parts, and any baubles you break may cost you dear.
Are you for Horizon? Across the bridge over Nophica's Wells, the road continues─follow it northward.
Time was, trade caravans would roll from the Silver Bazaar way, chock-full o' merchandise. Place ain't what it used to be, though.
Welcome to Horizon, the hub of trade, the navel of commerce, the middle of─uh, the middle of it all! The gate you see before you is the eastern portal, the Sunrise Gate.
Horizon is just through the tunnel. If you've a full load, speak to someone from the camp about using the winch contraption.
Beyond here, you shall find loathing and fear aplenty: the fell creatures of Parata's Peace, and should you survive, an imperial outpost. May Thal guide and keep you from harm.
The residential district for adventurers─why, the Goblet's practically within swinging reach of this gate. The resident caretaker's the one to speak to if you've a nesting urge.
Welcome to Ul'dah! Step up, step through, and keep on moving, please. Just my luck to pull duty for the Gate of Nald─only the most trafficked gate in the city!
Every traveler is welcome in Ul'dah, just as every grain of sand has a place in the dune! Just through the Gate of Thal is the Sapphire Avenue Exchange, one of the greatest markets in all of Eorzea.
Ain't no days when Black Brush Station isn't busy. Steel, copper, iron─demand's grown higher 'n' higher since the Calamity. Wish I could say the same of my pay!
The eastward route follows the ol' Royal Allagan Sunway. Takes you all the way to the Black Shroud by way of Camp Drybone and Highbridge.
This is Camp Drybone, the watch and ward on the Royal Allagan Sunway. Right now, 'tis the Amalj'aa we keep an eye out and a sword close at hand for.
May Thal lift their burdens and dry their tears! Sometimes it is more than I can stand, to look upon those who seek out the church.
Go due east on the Royal Allagan Sunway for Highbridge, or take the trail that branches north for the Golden Bazaar. Whichever way you go, you'll likely meet a lizardman or two.
We've naught to fear so long as we've our captain─'specially not the Qiqirn, those egg-eatin' shrews!
Can't trust those rat bastards, you can't. There's been word of suspicious activity, which is why we were sent to guard Highbridge.
Got to look good for Captain Longhaft, don't we?
Don't you worry none about Highbridge. We're Brass Blades of the Orchid, handpicked by Captain Hunberct himself!
Prickly, those Ala Mhigans. Don't know if they came that way or if it's the Garlean trouble, but best to give them wide berth.
Why do I want to go home to Ul'dah? Let's see, the folk are too rustic by half, there are more peistes than pieshops, and lizardmen are aprowl just a stone's throw away.
What would an adventurer want in Little Ala Mhigo? Whatever or whoever brings you here, I suggest you conclude your business with some alacrity.
Last oasis for the killing malms ahead, my water-plump friend. Know it and know it well, if you've a mind to venture into the Sagolii.
A fine hunter is U'lamana, most fiiine. Not many among the U make my tail curl so.
You'll find Ulhuadshi easy to discern, I think. A chiefess among sandworms, she is larger than most and is a pleasing shade of rose red.
Tell me, what stands between Ul'dah and Garlemald? The Immortal Flames. When the Empire marches southward, let it enjoy the hospitality of Camp Bluefog first!
Amajina & Sons may own the Ceruleum Processing Plant, aye. But with forces of Garlemald encamped so close by, it falls upon the Immortal Flames to provide the necessary degree of protection.
Before us is Raubahn's Push, and on the other side lies Castrum Meridianum. Beware, for foes as well as friends patrol the field.
This is one of the gates of Gridania, the Blue Badger Gate. A wise novice knows not to wander too far beyond these portals...
Walk softly─there are fell creatures in these parts. Remember that the Central Shroud has two faces, depending on whether you remain above or take the Matron's Lethe to the Jadeite Thick below.
You are always welcome at Dunstan's Spire, humble as it is. Stay awhile and rest your weary feet.
I keep my eyes peeled for desertin' recruits, not beasties. We Wailers work our young ones hard, I'll cry that.
This ain't the entrance, adventurer. Come on through if you must, but watch for stray arrows, eh? Green recruits about.
Sure look fluffy. Bet they'd like being scratched...hey! I'm on duty here─go talk to someone else!
Chocobos are the key to supply transport, and Bentbranch Meadows raises a fine flock.
Going south? Be prepared to fight─and to run. Some beasts that cannot be overcome can still be outrun.
I love the view of the Mirror from here. The bustle of folk, the tranquility of the water... Dear would I sell my life to protect this.
An adventurer, by the look of you. Smells sweet, does it not? Sweetbloom Pier it's called, and not for nothing.
Go east and you'll find less agreeable company─the sylphs. Stay well away unless you've good reason to see them.
Welcome! Welcome to the gracious Hawthorne Hut─not that it's mine to welcome you to, ha, far from it! Master Hawthorne is within, if you've a mind to speak to him.
Saw that ruin to the north, did you? Was a watchtower once, aye. Master Buscarron manned the ramparts there when he was a raw recruit.
Nobody's turned away from Buscarron's Druthers, not even lawbreakers and poachers. So long as you raise no hand 'gainst another within these walls, you're welcome at the Druthers!
An adventurer, eh? Well met! Hang up your cloak and wet your whistle─we'll keep watch for any beasties.
An adventurer. Ah. I've no objection to you staying in Quarrymill, but I won't countenance any...distress caused to the locals or elementals.
There's rich soil and plentiful water in Quarrymill. Trees do well here, aye─you will have heard of the orchards in these parts.
Even the bounty of the forest has its limits. To loot it for your own gains is to court the wrath of the elementals...
Does the sight shock you? You should have seen it before the Calamity. Sweet land, it was.
The plants and animals of Rootslake, you'll find nowhere else. Magnificent, this place, and terrible...
The wet and the stink─it's like living in a cheesemonger's sock. Worst. Assignment. Ever.
Take the Lumberline due north through the forest and she'll take you to Gridania...eventually.
This is the Yellow Serpent Gate, raised after the Calamity to serve as a new portal to Gridania.
Uh, if you'd be so kind as to not go poking into things? Training's a delicate time for chocobos.
You can't be too careful of Ixal around here. It wouldn't take much more than a well-aimed peck to take Hyrstmill, when it comes down to it.
Here I stand watch but...if one of those things out there decides to come calling, ain't much I can do by myself.
Part of our job's keeping the beasts of Alder Springs away from Gridania. 'Tis a mucky job, but someone's got to do it.
Make good use of the aetheryte, now. These broken lands are well loved by the most savage of creatures.
If it's Coerthas you're wanting to reach, just follow the road westward. Ware the cold─don't say I didn't warn you.
This is Fallgourd Float, the hamlet built right on the waters of a lake. Many a jape's been made on the matter, you can be sure.
The birdmen are too familiar a sight for comfort these days. Whatever they're planning, we'd better find out quick...
This here's the Zephyr Gate, the great threshold to Limsa Lominsa! Wind to dry the sweat on our brows, and cool the fever o' journey, eh? Eh? Ha!
Felt the wind that comes in from Moraby Bay, did ye? Fit to hull chestnuts! No wonder the gate back there's called the Tempest Gate.
Oschon's Embrace's still under construction, no sense looking accusing about it. It'll take you across all the same, so just count your blessings.
All along the shoreline here, there's a sight to write home about. Shards of the false moon Dalamud, that's how it happened.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: They say it was a rain of fire. The sea boiled off in moments and left those pillars of salt...

19 [0x0][0x18]: Uh, the new crafter, are you? No!? What are you, then, a stevedore? A─oh. Beg pardon, adventurer!
Just through the gate is Mist, a residential area for adventurers built on the orders of Admiral Merlwyb herself.
Guard duty's dull duty... Good coin, though. Could say it's golden duty, can't ye? Gil makes all the difference, it does.
Blue skies, cascade of flowers, colors of the tropics... They say Master Gegeruju paid a pretty penny indeed for this view!
I volunteered to guard the beach and which beach do they send me to? Not the one with frolicking danseuses, oh no. Instead, I get to watch crabs scuttle.
You are in Wineport, under the protection of the Maelstrom! Identify yourself!
20 [0x0][0x1c]: No imperial forces shall pass by trick or force! Adventurers, however, are to be allowed through!

19 [0x0][0x18]: Not much to see around here except the aetheryte. Don't know why they bothered to put one in a half-dead hamlet like Swiftperch.
Smell that? There's some fine ale being poured as we speak. Would go down well right about now.
Sahagin to the west, kobolds to the north─that's our sworn duty, to be a shield of Aleport against the beastmen. That, and dealing with mean drunks...
Outside the seawall, the Sahagin rule. Grabbed themselves more territory in the aftermath of the Calamity, damn their eyes.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: If the seawall's breached, they can come ashore in force. And that, the Maelstrom can't allow. Not today and not tomorrow!

19 [0x0][0x18]: If you've an itch to go west of the wall, ask the medic for some unguent. There's nothing but fishbacks and death out there. Of course, some folk go for that sort of thing.
The healing baths here in Camp Bronze Lake date back to ancient Nym. You are welcome to soak the body and ease the mind─but not to bump and grind!
This is no place for a pleasure tour, outlander! The Observatorium is key to Ishgard's defense, and the Dravanians know it well.
That ravine once held a griffin's roost, you know. The nest is long gone, but Griffin Crossing marks the place. You'll find the bridge to the southeast, though it be impassable.
Camp Dragonhead welcomes all who would stand with House Fortemps─even a lowly adventurer.
A post by the fire makes sentry duty go faster. So warm. Like goose down and...and... Ahem! I am alert, alert I say!
Nothing but trouble and toil ahead, you know. Natalan crawls with Ixal, the Ogre's Belly has the worst sort of voidsent...and there're bedbugs in the barracks.
Conversation is an indulgence unbecoming the protectors of Ishgard. Never shall I drop my guard, for Dravanians and unbelievers rest not in their connivance.
I regard the scarred hulk of the Stone Vigil and wonder: how long must we sing this song, wait for this victory? A century...or two...? I pray it comes soon.
Our enemies lack nothing in ferity, whether they be mere dragonfly or thrustaevis─but we lack all caution. That is our strength, and their undoing.
You're home, adventurer, when you're in Revenant's Toll! There's both rest and work aplenty, courtesy of the Adventurers' Guild!
Sentry duty on the other side's a lark, but the Garlean outpost is on this side of the Toll. Always a bit too glad to see the end of the shift, know what I mean?
Adventuring and sentry duty sometimes don't mix. Every time I catch a glimpse of the Crystal Tower, all I can think is “How do I get inside?”
At Master Alphinaud's request, the Maelstrom has taken measures to deter any further exploration of the caverns beneath Castrum Occidens.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: So long as the castrum remains, however, we must keep watch for signs of imperial activity.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Have a care when exploring the southern reaches of Alder Springs. Though I understand the desire to examine that massive structure up close, the surrounding area is rife with lumbering golems.

It is fortunate that no imperial forces bar your path into this fragment of Dalamud, but do not underestimate the dangers that lurk without. As for the dangers that lie within, I have little insight or advice to offer beyond the painfully obvious: prepare for the worst.
I know not what occurred within the fragment, but Lady Alisaie appeared most troubled upon her return. I will, of course, attend to her as best I can, but your aid should be welcome as well.
'Tis a burden to know what others cannot, to be unable to rejoice in our accomplishments. Yet I understand the reasons why.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: For what it is worth, <if:Mistress/Master> <surname>, thank you. For Lady Alisaie, for her family...thank you.

19 [0x0][0x18]: Quite a dazzling array of wares, wouldn't you say?
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Ever since you helped us bring an end to the ambushes and lure the Homunculi back to Gridania for good, the gil's been flowing in like a waterfall.
21 [0x0][0x20]: But I didn't get to where I am today by resting on my laurels. Should you hear of any promising business ventures, you know where to find me!

19 [0x0][0x18]: Greetings, <if:madam/sir>. Shall I show you inside?
Heretics, Dravanians─old, familiar enemies. This is something beyond all imagination.
So another caravan has been waylaid by the followers of Iceheart─a name which has reached my ears many times of late.
My knowledge of primals pales in comparison to your own. Nevertheless, the circumstances surrounding this particular summoning are...unique, no?
20 [0x0][0x1c]: 'Twould be most unfortunate if they were reproduced, I should think.

19 [0x0][0x18]: One tailors their tactics to the enemy─in our case, Dravanians. Primals will require a somewhat different approach.
'Twould be foolish to dismiss alternative approaches when contending with such clever foes...
I think we can all agree that a formidable foe demands a calculated response.
Some still think these heretics do not pose a great threat. The slain House Fortemps knights would surely beg to differ.
'Twas less a wall and more a sieve, considering how many tunnels we discovered.
Do not your Braves hail from all across Eorzea? Why then did you choose to bring southrons to the highlands?
This is no place for a son of the sand! I tell you, if a merchant offered me wools at a premium, I would be fair tempted.
'Tis not a matter of training your eyes, I fear. Without foreknowledge or serendipity, we will never find every tunnel.
20 [0x0][0x1c]: The very land conspires against us─the broken ice ever reforming to conceal the entrances.

19 [0x0][0x18]: 'Tis not as if I do not understand. In my youth, more than once did I find myself pressing forward, neglecting to pay sufficient heed to those around me. Let us hope that Alphinaud shows greater sense.
The Gates of Judgement have been opened but a crack. It will take considerable effort to see them flung wide once more.
Louisoix understood the risks inherent in summoning a higher power─but does Iceheart, I wonder?
20 [0x0][0x1c]: Salvation at the cost of your soul is anything but...

19 [0x0][0x18]: Moenbryda is a brilliant and dedicated scholar. I would not have endorsed her plan were it not so.
The events of recent days have placed a terrible strain on us all. Ever more keenly do I feel the weight of responsibility upon my breast.
Eline, what have you done...?
How are we to know the unknowable─to comprehend the unfathomable? The one true god, the fallen lord among wyrms...even Mother Hydaelyn. Inscrutable entities, all, far beyond our ken.

I traveled to Ul'dah to meet with Thancred's friend─the one who promised us that rare ore?─and she began cursing me with words I've only ever heard from the mouths of pirates. I still have no idea what she was so angry about...

We were able to locate those elusive manuscripts in the archives of the Thaumaturges' Guild. I had not spoken much with the new guildmasters, but thankfully they were quite willing to accommodate us in our search.

I'm pushing ahead with my research as quickly as I dare. The next time you face an Ascian, I would have you fight with the proper weapon in hand.

Dance of Ok' Zundu as precious as rising sun that gives nourishment of light─does netherling's village have dance as well?
<forename>─I will not judge you by your curious name. What I will judge you by, however, is your performance during my Trials of Trustworthiness, kupo!
If your tummy's gloopy or your wings're droopy, I've a potion to fix that!

Go on, stare at me if you must, kupo! I have grown accustomed to such gazes of unadulterated adoration. Creatures of my surpassing beauty are rare in the lands below, I should imagine...
Have you ever seen such a splendid flower, kupo? I water it every day─ I can't wait to see it grow even more!

Are you surprised to see such a fierce-looking moogle, kupo? The Pomguard must defend Chieftain Moglin and all of Moghome. Mind your manners in front of the chieftain─and don't make him repeat himself.

Have you come to admire my latest piece, kupo? I have been attempting to capture in oils the essence of the humble kupo nut, but inspiration is fleeting. ...Especially when the rumble in my belly overpowers the passion in my heart.
No other place in Moghome gets more nourishing sunlight, so this is the ideal place to grow kupo trees, cloud mallow, and any other precious plants we want to protect from the brutish skylords, kupo.
I'm gonna build the biggest collection of shiny landlord treasures any moogle has ever seen, kupo! And then, I'll bask in the envy of everyone in Moghome!
Mognell and I are here to keep an eye on the dragons, kupo. Ever since Nidhogg roared, they've been up to no good.
The dragons look as small as kupo nuts from up here, and even I can crush a kupo nut, kupo! I'd go down and squish them, but I'm a little tired today. Maybe tomorrow...
When I see all the marvelous structures and glittering tools the landlords made, I can't help but want to know more about them, kupo!
Flowers are one of the most precious things that grow here, kupo. One day, I want to grow a whole field of them, and invite people from the surface to come gaze on their beauty.
